page.title: 07Hill and Farm Cattle.
page.content: The cattle on most farms are beef cattle with a few milkers on certain farms. The most popular milking cow is the black and white Friesan cow which gives a good supply of milk. These are docile animals, and are found on the better land in enclosed good pasture. On poorer and higher pastures and selected areas of enclosed moorland there may be herds of suckler cows. Suckler herds usually consist of black cows continually running with a beef bred bull, either the white faced red Hereford, the dark cream Charollais or the black or red Limousin. Such cattle are semi-wild and care should be taken to avoid going into fields where they are grazing.
